nodes.label: Dictionary
nodes.desc: This project aims to facilitate a common understanding of frequently used terms across the construction industry, connect these terms to vetted learning material, and act as a reference to current and future online tools

nodes.label: Project Admin
nodes.desc: Managing project scope, resources and timeline. Development of protocols; instigating and managing relationships with 3rd parties; and continuous alignment with other BIMe Initiative projects.

nodes.label: Canonical English
nodes.desc: Development and updating of Dictionary Items covering all common international terms within Noteworthy BIM Publications plus those identified within national and international standards in English.

nodes.label: ISO Standards Topic Curation
nodes.desc: inclusion and alignment of ISO terms and definitions witin the dictionary

nodes.label: Extended Descriptions
nodes.desc: Identification and invitation of subject matter experts to contribute texts, charts and videos to extend the summary description of specific terms into short encyclopedic entries. Each Extended Description is a separate Work Package within the Microproject.

nodes.label: LOTE Translations
nodes.desc: Translation and continuous updating of Language Other Than English (LOTE) terms. Each Language Team will have its own Microproject Code - assigned by chronological order (e.g. A4.01 Spanish Language).

nodes.label: Spanish
nodes.desc: Spanish Translation of terms and descriptions

nodes.label: Catalan
nodes.desc: Catalan Translation of terms and descriptions

nodes.label: Dictionaries
nodes.desc: terms and their descriptions as defined in:

nodes.id: Peer Reviewed Papers by BIMei Founders
nodes.label: Peer Reviewed Papers by BIMei Founders
nodes.desc: of relevance to the BIMei KB

nodes.label: Collaborative Publications
nodes.desc: (in collaboration with other entities) published on BIMei websites

nodes.label: Reports
nodes.desc: (e.g. Macro Adoption Reports in Spain and Ireland)

nodes.label: Authors and co-authors
nodes.desc: (e.g. autors of BIM ThinkSpace posts or peer-reviewed articles)

nodes.label: BIM Dictionary Project editors, co-editors and reviewers

nodes.label: Localisations
nodes.desc: Localisation of terms and descriptions based on jurisdictions and geographical locations.

nodes.label: Tool Development
nodes.desc: Development of varied tools as needed by the BIMei Community.

nodes.label: Tool Development - Front End
nodes.desc: Continuous improvement of the online UI/UX. Generation of a Terminology Explorer (interactive map); Custom Terms List; built-in Commenting Engine; and printing, exporting and linking features.

nodes.label: Tool Development - Backend
nodes.desc: Development of an Editorial Dashboard to manage translations/updates and communication amongst Editors.Improvement of versioning and version control (allowing external links to a specific version). Database optimisation. Improvement and documentation of the API.

nodes.label: Outreach Programme
nodes.desc: Establishing collaboration agreements and promoting the use of the BIM Dictionary by varied organisations.

nodes.label: Outreach to Educational Institutions
nodes.desc: Connecting with universities and other technical institutes to encourage adoption of the BIM Dictionary in educational settings.

nodes.label: Outreach to Industry Associations
nodes.desc: Connecting with membership-based organisations to encourage adoption of the BIM Dictionary in their CPD programmes.

nodes.label: Outreach to Policy Makers
nodes.desc: Connecting with authorities to develop country-specific addendums to materials within the BIM Dictionary.

nodes.label: Knowledge Organisation
nodes.desc: Ontologies, Taxonomies and Topics (applicable across BIMei)

nodes.label: Community Forums
nodes.desc: Management of forums.bimexcellence.org (stopped, to be replaced)

nodes.label: Seminars
nodes.desc: Preparation and delivery of public events including conferences, online seminars, and similar activities.

nodes.label: Rich Media
nodes.desc: Development of videos, podcasts and interactive content covering the BIMe Initiative as a whole

nodes.label: Translations & Localisations
nodes.desc: Translation and localisation of resources and webpages; each is a Workpackage

nodes.label: Publications
nodes.desc: Publications of varied types (peer-reviewed papers, printable books, and newsletters)

nodes.label: Conceptual Components
nodes.desc: Delivery of conceptual components leading to the development of practical template and online modules.

nodes.label: Competence Inventories
nodes.desc: Collating and maintaining an inventory of Competence Items

nodes.label: Conceptual Components
nodes.desc: Delivery of conceptual components leading to the development of practical template and online modules.

nodes.label: Performance Improvement Templates
nodes.desc: The development and continuous update of the performance improvement templates and matrices.

nodes.label: Maturity Matrix GL1
nodes.desc: The development and continuous update of the BIM Maturity Matrix at Granularity Level 1 - currently available as 301in BIM Maturity Matrix.

nodes.label: Maturity Matrix GL2
nodes.desc: The development and continuous update of the BIM Maturity Matrix at Granularity Level 2.

nodes.label: Project Admin
nodes.desc: Managing project scope, resources and timeline; development of protocols; instigating and managing relationships with 3rd party collaborators (by country or by region); and continuous alignment with other BIMe Initiative projects.

nodes.label: Concepts, Methods, and Metrics
nodes.desc: Development, adaptation and testing of new macro-focused adoption frameworks, models, taxonomies, metrics, and their composite templates

nodes.label: Macro Adoption Studies
nodes.desc: Launching a Macro Adoption assessment campaign within a selected country or region. Each Macro Assessment project will be led by a local player.

nodes.label: Macro Adoption Guide
nodes.desc: The development of a guide (an edited book or booklet) to help policy makers develop, implement, or improve their BIM policies and/or national initiatives.

nodes.label: Macro Adoption Report
nodes.desc: Design and delivery of the BIMe Initiative biannual report that discusses the state of BIM Adoption worldwide.

nodes.label: Macro Adoption Library
nodes.desc: Mapping useful macro adoption resources and international Noteworthy Publications.

nodes.label: Macro Adoption Dashboard
nodes.desc: Development of an online interactive dashboard to display Macro Adoption data with functionalities allowing users to: explore datasets; create custom views; export anonymised data; and print partial reports.

nodes.label: Model Use Templates
nodes.desc: Online template for each of the Domain Model Uses (73-80 total). Each Model Use Template (MUT) will be exceptionally conducted as a Microproject.

nodes.label: Software Classifications
nodes.desc: The development of a list, tool, and guide as needed to collate, classify, and maintain a comprehensive list of software tools used for designing, constructing, and operating all types of assets across their lifecycle.

nodes.label: LITE Framework
nodes.desc: Development and extension of the theoretical structure needed to represent information as it transforms and gets exchanged across an asset's lifecycle.

nodes.label: Modular Language
nodes.desc: Development and maintenance of the Modular Language (e.g. Information Uses, Activity Statements, and Defined Roles) that enable more efficient information exchanges between actors.

nodes.label: Indices and Matrices
nodes.desc: Development of measurement indices and decision support matrices for use across the asset lifecycle

nodes.label: Alignment Studies
nodes.desc: Studies investigating and/or facilitating alignments between the LITE approach and existing methodologies (e.g. Agile, Lean, and Concurrent Engineering)

nodes.label: Classifications
nodes.desc: The “meaningful clustering of experience” (Kwasnik, 1999, p. 24) and “lies at the heart of every scientific field” (Lohse, Biolsi, Walker, & Rueter, 1994, p. 36). Classification is also a heuristic tool useful during the formative stages of discovery, analysis and theorizing (Davies, 1989).

nodes.label: Competency Table
nodes.desc: Document focuses on the Domain Tier 1 and its 8 Competency Sets and 55 standard Competency Topics.

nodes.label: Competency Item
nodes.desc: A ‘phrase/sentence’ representing an ability, activity or outcome that can be assessed, learned, or applied. Belongs to a specific Competency Topic within a specific Competency Set.

nodes.label: Competency Topic
nodes.desc: A subject area within a Competency Set. Includes 10s or 100s of Competency Items.

nodes.label: Competency Set
nodes.desc: A group of related Competency Topics.

nodes.label: Domain Tier
nodes.desc: Focus of the 201in document. A competency tier.

nodes.label: Information Uses
nodes.desc: Intended applications of structured project information.

nodes.label: Dictionary Items
nodes.desc: Terms and their descriptions across different languages.

nodes.label: Learning Units
nodes.desc: A 'container' of learning items within a domain.

nodes.label: Managerial Set
nodes.desc: The decision-making abilities which drive the selection/adoption of long -term strategies and initiatives. Managerial competencies include leadership, strategic planning, and organizational management.

nodes.label: Administration Set
nodes.desc: The day -to-day organizational activities required to meet and maintain strategic objectives. Administration competencies include tendering and procurement, contract management, and human resource management.

nodes.label: Functional Set
nodes.desc: The non-technical, overall abilities required to initiate, manage and deliver projects. Functional competencies include collaboration, facilitation and project management.

nodes.label: General IT
nodes.desc: Designing, installing, managing, maintaining, and ensuring the security of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) infrastructure including databases, servers, and networks

nodes.label: Software Systems
nodes.desc: Selecting, deploying, and maintaining software systems in a multi-user environment

nodes.label: Hardware and Equipment
nodes.desc: Specifying, recommending, or procuring computer hardware and equipment

nodes.label: Modelling
nodes.desc: Generating BIModels based on pre-defined Modelling Standards and protocols

nodes.label: Documentation
nodes.desc: Generating drawings and construction documents using standardized details and workflows

nodes.label: Presentation and Animation
nodes.desc: Generating professional-quality renderings or 3D animations using Specialized Software Tools

nodes.label: Model Management
nodes.desc: Managing and maintaining BIModels generated using standardized processes, protocols, and specifications

nodes.label: Document Management
nodes.desc: Using Document Management Systems or similar to store, manage and share files and BIModels

nodes.label: Data Management
nodes.desc: Managing data flows – speed, volume, quality, and security - across project, asset, and information lifecycles

nodes.label: Implementation Fundamentals
nodes.desc: Identifying and managing issues associated with BIM implementation

nodes.label: Component Development
nodes.desc: Implementing a structured approach for developing or customizing Model Components using documented Modelling Standards

nodes.label: Library Management
nodes.desc: Developing or managing component libraries as required for the standardized delivery of BIM Projects

nodes.label: Standardization and Templates
nodes.desc: Generating standardized templates, item lists and workflows for initiating, checking or delivering BIM Projects

nodes.label: Technical Training
nodes.desc: Developing a BIM Training Plan or maintaining a Skill Register to track staff training and their acquired skills

nodes.label: System and Process Testing
nodes.desc: Assessing the capability/compatibility of systems and the suitability of workflows and procedures

nodes.label: Guides and Manuals
nodes.desc: Developing guides, manuals or educational material covering Model-based Workflows

nodes.label: General IT Support
nodes.desc: Troubleshooting software issues and supporting staff in resolving technical problems

nodes.label: Data and Network Support
nodes.desc: Managing and maintaining the storage of data, documents, 2D Drawings and BIModels

nodes.label: Equipment Support
nodes.desc: Developing specifications for BIM Hardware and BIM Hardware Deployment Programmes

nodes.label: Software Support
nodes.desc: Addressing issues related to BIM Software Tools, fulfilling relevant Support Tasks and managing the relationship with software vendors/resellers

nodes.label: Software and Web Development
nodes.desc: Developing extensions for BIM Software Tools, productivity software or web portals to improve BIM Deliverables

nodes.label: General Research and Development
nodes.desc: Conducting general or BIM-specific research and development activities

nodes.label: Strategy Development and Planning
nodes.desc: Developing a BIM Implementation Strategy or a BIM Implementation Plan to guide BIM Adoption

nodes.label: Teaching and Coaching
nodes.desc: Developing BIM training material to educate staff and facilitate the BIM Adoption process

nodes.label: Knowledge Management and Engineering
nodes.desc: Developing a Knowledge Management Strategy and capturing/representing the BIM-specific knowledge of staff

nodes.label: Change Management
nodes.desc: Developing a Change Management strategy that accompanies/supports the BIM Implementation process

nodes.label: Research and Analysis
nodes.desc: Participating in and/or publishing academic research focused on BIM innovation or collaboration

nodes.label: Industry Engagement and Knowledge Sharing
nodes.desc: Sharing BIM knowledge and experience with the wider industry through formal/informal workshops, seminars, and presentations

nodes.label: BIMe Initiative
nodes.desc: A not-for-profit effort guided by a set of Principles undertaken by volunteer researchers from both industry and academia. It is supported by in-kind contributions, commercial services, and institutional/corporate sponsorship.

nodes.label: BIMe Initiative Principles
nodes.desc: Includes both General Principles and the Excellence Manifesto.

nodes.label: Knowledge Foundations
nodes.desc: Representing conceptual constructs (e.g. a taxonomy or methodology).

nodes.label: Knowledge Blocks
nodes.desc: Representing modular units of Structured Information (e.g. Competency items) that can be combined into larger modular units (e.g. Defined Roles)

nodes.label: Knowledge Workflows
nodes.desc: Representing procedures (e.g. assessment procedure), scripts or routines.

nodes.label: Knowledge Tools
nodes.desc: Representing software application (e.g. phone App), modules or templates.

nodes.label: Focus Areas
nodes.desc: Disciplinary Lens used to organize BIMe Initiative Projects.

nodes.label: Performance Management
nodes.desc: Focus Area covering performance assessment and benchmarking.

nodes.label: Learning Management
nodes.desc: Focus Area covering education, training and e-learning.

nodes.label: Implementation Management
nodes.desc: Focus Area covering implementation/diffusion of innovative systems.

nodes.label: Information Management
nodes.desc: Focus Area covering information/data capture and analysis.

nodes.label: Knowledge Management
nodes.desc: Focus Area covering knowledge capture, engineering and sharing.

nodes.label: Research and Delivery Management
nodes.desc: Focus Area covering development/management of the BIMe Initiative, its network and innovative projects.

nodes.label: Organisational Scales
nodes.desc: Scoping Lens used to classify projects according to the 12 scales of the Organisational Hierarchy.

nodes.label: Concepts
nodes.desc: Conceptual Lens; BIMe Initiative Projects can be tagged using the 50 or more Concepts identified within the BIM Ontology (e.g. facility, role and system).

nodes.label: Programmes
nodes.desc: BIMe Initiative Projects can be clustered into Programmes if they need to (a) be repeated in different markets (e.g. conducting benchmarking exercises in a number of countries); (b) form part of a collaborative agreement with other research groups or networks; or (c) conform with specific funding arrangements.

nodes.label: Portfolios
nodes.desc: BIMe Initiative Projects can be collated into custom Portfolios including: (a) an overall ledger of every projects conducted using the initiative’s Knowledge Object Libraries; and (b) personal ledgers collating all projects and products delivered by individual BIMe Members.

nodes.label: BIMe Initiative Network
nodes.desc: Document that must be read in conjunction with 103in.

nodes.label: BIMexcellence.org
nodes.desc: Website for public sharing and accessing BIMe Initiative resources.

nodes.label: Top-Level Project
nodes.desc: A project that leads to an end product (Published Guide or Software Application). May include existing and new components.

nodes.label: Knowledge Object Library
nodes.desc: A public resource available through BIMexcellence.org containing existing components (e.g., taxonomy, metric).

nodes.label: Microproject
nodes.desc: Smaller project conducted by BIMe Members to generate new components (e.g., framework, software module).

nodes.label: BIMe Product
nodes.desc: A Published Guide or a Software Application delivered through a Top-Level Project.

nodes.label: Product Library
nodes.desc: A webpage on BIMexcellence.org where new BIMe Products are released.

nodes.label: Project Space
nodes.desc: Wiki pages, chat rooms, and physical meetings accessible only to BIMe Members and invited collaborators.

nodes.label: Class E: Leaders | Primary Authors
nodes.desc: Responsible for project goals, resources, ethical standards, reporting, research team management, peer-reviewed paper delivery, and concept/method development.

nodes.label: Class D: Investigators | Managers | Secondary Authors
nodes.desc: Work with leaders, responsible for Microprojects or Workpackages, and contribute to peer-reviewed papers.

nodes.label: Class C: Contributors | Facilitators
nodes.desc: Participate in research, potentially responsible for specialized activities (research officer, data analyst, software developer, etc.). Includes workshop facilitators.

nodes.label: Class B: Reviewers | Testers
nodes.desc: Activities include critical review and software testing.

nodes.label: Class A: Users | Readers
nodes.desc: Activities vary depending on project requirements.

nodes.label: Workpackage
nodes.desc: An optional cluster of activities within large or complex projects.

nodes.label: Activity
nodes.desc: A defined effort within a Workpackage or a Project.

nodes.label: Task
nodes.desc: A subdivision of an Activity into smaller work units.

nodes.label: Step
nodes.desc: The chronological order to complete a task (steps are indivisible units).

nodes.label: Rich Text
nodes.desc: Code is followed by unique ID e.g. RTEXT1907

nodes.label: Integrated information framework
nodes.desc: Development of an integrated information framework

nodes.label: Verification and validation routines
nodes.desc: Development of verification and validation routines

nodes.label: Information Use information modules
nodes.desc: Collation of Information Use information modules

nodes.label: BIM Excellence
nodes.desc: A unique research-based approach to digital innovation in the construction industry. It provides an integrated methodology and a modular language for performance assessment, learning and process optimisation.

nodes.label: Model Uses
nodes.desc: Model Uses identify and collate the Information Requirements that need to be delivered as – or embedded within – 3D digital models. As a Knowledge Block, Model Uses form part of a larger modular language that connects information requirements with System Units, Defined Roles, and Competency Items.

nodes.label: BIMe Initiative Principles
nodes.desc: BIMe Initiative Principles (BIMe Principles, or Principles for short) includes both General Principles and the Excellence Manifesto.

nodes.label: Conservation Modelling
nodes.desc: Historical Site Modelling; Historical Excavation Modelling; Ancient Monument Modelling

nodes.label: Decorative Modelling
nodes.desc: Wrought Iron Modelling; Gypsum Decorations Modelling; Sculptural Modelling; Fountain Design Modelling

nodes.label: Ducted Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Fresh-air Systems Modelling; Exhaust Systems Modelling; Smoke-extraction Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Façade Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Glazing Systems Modelling; Cladding Systems Modelling; Curtain Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Flue Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Chimney Systems Modelling; Exhaust Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Fuel Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Liquefied-gas Supply Systems Modelling; Liquid-fuel Systems Modelling; Gas-supply Systems Modelling

nodes.label: HVAC Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Heating Systems Modelling; Ventilation Systems Modelling; Air-conditioning Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Hydraulic Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Plumbing Systems Modelling; Compressed-air Systems Modelling; Steam Systems Modelling; Sewage Systems Modelling; Black-water Systems Modelling; Grey-water Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Information Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Computer Systems Modelling; Communication Systems Modelling; Telecommunication Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Infrastructure Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Underground Systems Modelling; Supply Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Power Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Generator Systems Modelling; Low-voltage Systems Modelling; Medium-voltage Systems Modelling; High-voltage Systems Modelling; Battery Systems Modelling; Electrical Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Security Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Surveillance Systems Modelling; Alarm Systems Modelling; Modelling; Listening Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Spatial Inspection Modelling
nodes.desc: Zone Modelling; Height-inspection Modelling; Clearance-space Modelling; Line-of-sight Modelling

nodes.label: Terrain Modelling
nodes.desc: Topographical Modelling; Site Modelling; Geological Modelling; Geotechnical Engineering Modelling; Open-pit Modelling

nodes.label: Timber Structures Modelling
nodes.desc: Timber Frame Modelling; Truss Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Transportation Systems Modelling
nodes.desc: Rail Systems Modelling; Road Systems Modelling

nodes.label: Vertical Circulation Modelling
nodes.desc: Elevator Systems Modelling; Stair Systems Modelling; Escalator Systems Modelling; Vertical Conveyance Modelling

nodes.label: General Model Uses
nodes.desc: applicable across industries, information systems and knowledge domains. include the word ‘modelling’ in their name and are typically measured using granularity metrics (e.g. Le vel of Definition , Level of Development and Granularity Level ) at component/item level. There are currently 52 General MUs – with 100s of potential synonyms – organized as a single MU Series, General Modelling (1000-1990)

nodes.label: Life Cycle Assessment (replaces Whole Life Cycle Analysis)
Modelling of a floating sculpture with a wave-powered signalling beacon
nodes.desc: Hypothetical Custom Model Use: Modelling of a floating sculpture with a wave-powered signalling beacon

nodes.label: Modelling security systems for a correctional facility
nodes.desc: Hypothetical Custom Model Use: Modelling security systems for a correctional facility

nodes.label: Modelling ventilation systems for an astronaut staging station on the moon
nodes.desc: Hypothetical Custom Model Use: Modelling ventilation systems for an astronaut staging station on the moon

nodes.label: Paper A10
nodes.desc: Concepts updated after publication of Paper A10

nodes.label: ChangeAgents AEC pty ltd
nodes.desc: The BIMe Initiative is managed by ChangeAgents AEC pty ltd.
